instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
threads.message:
Hi everybody,

i received a MacBookAir from 2016 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A) with a liquid da, U5800mage. I replaced components around <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>, many components around <CHIP>U6101</CHIP> such as <CHIP>U3210</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> (Baclkight IC) and the LCD-Connector (there were some burnmarks on pins 2-4).
I also replaced the cable of the display.
So far so good - device is booting with chimes and i got external display (unforunately i lose signal after few minutes) but i don't get internal display. 
I got the initial 3.3V on  <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>  in the first few seconds after booting but they don't stay.

So my question is: Where is my fault? Could it be a badly reballed Backlight IC? Or is it a bad LCD connector (I unsoldered one of a donor board and reused it)?
Is there any way to check why the screen is not detected? 
It's not the screen - i already tested it with a kown working assembly.

Thank you and best regards
Dudidpupan

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
threads.message:
"I got the initial 3.3V on  <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>  in the first few seconds after booting"
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high at same time?

I hope you've checked voltage with LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
threads.message:
No,  <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> does not go high!

Yes, LCD is connected :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> the rail for checking LCD connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R8350</RESISTOR> is good. I think I messed up the LCD connector when unsoldering it from the old board. Tried it with a loose lcd cable and diode mode on the multimeter bit didnt get any connection. So I will wait for my new LCD connectors and change it again :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Chimes and external display but no internal display (screen not detected?)
threads.message: It works with the new LCD connector soldered on. Thank you again! :)
